channel.title: The weirdest thing :\NEED PROFESSIONAL HELP
channel.description:
hi my server has been in "beta" for a while with around 10 players and has been working fine. but yesterday out of nowhere i tried logging in and it says error connecting to server which means its down.... and no1 else can login i checked my port forwarding and my no-ip... i even made a NEW ip address to check and it wont work.... the only things that work is 127.0.0.0 and 0.0.0.0 (local hosts) i got NO clue whats wrong i think maybe a connection problem between server and client?
please someone this is kind of urgent i was anticipating release soon :\
ty in advance for helping

item.title: The weirdest thing :\NEED PROFESSIONAL HELP
item.dc:creator: @mochronik mochronik
item.description:
@mochronik wrote:

ty guys i was asleep… kindler i read ur post lawl and ye u guys both right BUT my no-ip is 100%… and my IP connection is same (that’s first thing i checked on) and i tried different client and it wouldn’t connect… im not a noob :\ lol but this is just pure weird :\ i really need some help lol

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Kindler Kindler
item.description:
@Kindler wrote:

did no1 look at my post then - ffs

item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:6, topic:275871”]newty, doubt that
i highly doubt theres a possible code that people would actualy add that would stop conections…
unles its part a tutorial that the tut maker put in there to fuck up the persons server… hmmm

gud point im going to sleep, gl figuring out the problem :)[/quote]

Woops, reread his post. I though he meant players were disconnecting upon login. So, yeah, your right garza

item.title: The weirdest thing :\NEED PROFESSIONAL HELP
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

If the above doesn’t work, it could be a problem in something that you have added recently.

Read full topic

item.title: The weirdest thing :\NEED PROFESSIONAL HELP
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

check ur port forwarding again with ur
prompt -> cmd -> ipconfig

ur ip may have changed

or maybe ur no-ip is broken? open up no-ip, make sure its open at all times…

on the interface box thing it is… theres a box near ur ip, click on that box so there’s a checkmark on it, wait til the smily turns into a smily face, or a red frowny face, if its frowny u gotta renew it on no-ip.com
if its a smily, everything with ur no-ip is running smooth

Read full topic

item.title: The weirdest thing :\NEED PROFESSIONAL HELP
item.dc:creator: @Kindler Kindler
item.description:
@Kindler wrote:

  1. Could be a severe internal server error
  2. Is your ip out of date? ( no-ip.biz .org ect; )
  3. Your “Rule” or “43594” portforward may be disabled, if your on ADSL then just click on it and re-add it to the used rules
  4. Have you tried a different source and IP?

Read full topic
